history.text: Hello
Hello!
We are going to talk about the movie The Shape of Water (2017)
Have you heard anything about it?
That was easy.
Yes! I love Del Toro and I love Doug Jones, but I am poor and haven't gotten to see it.

The Shape of Water​ is a 2017 American fantasy drama film directed by Guillermo del Toro as you say and the plot is about
 a mute custodian at a high-security government laboratory who falls in love with a captured
humanoid amphibian creature.
Yes, I know... thanks. :)
I'm kind of annoyed that Doug wasn't nominated for anything. I hear the performance was amazing.

Some of the casting are the actors Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Richard
Jenkins, Doug Jones, as you know,
 Michael Stuhlbarg, and Octavia Spencer.

This film received good ratings: at Rotten Tomatoes: 92% and average: 8.4/10 and also at Metacritic a Score of
 87/100
I do wish they had cast an actually mute actress. Disabled folk need more roles.
But I suppose the representation is still good.
Yes that's a good point. Do you generally watch movies with good ratings?
nah. Public opinion means very little to me. I'll consider them but they don't make my decision.
Dancer in The Dark, for example, highly rated, I hated it. Hated. I hope the director eats some bad meat.
I have already seen the movie and i would recommend it to you.
You don't sound like a bot at all. Very natural, lol
Some more details about the plot

Elisa Esposito, who as an orphaned child, was found in a river with wounds on her neck, is
mute, and communicates through sign language. She lives alone in an apartment above a
cinema, and works as a cleaning-woman at a secret government laboratory in Baltimore at
the height of the Cold War. Her friends are her closeted next-door neighbor Giles, a
struggling advertising illustrator who shares a strong bond with her, and her co-worker
Zelda, a woman who also serves as her interpreter at work.
I wonder how much ASL the actors had to learn. Admirable. I hope to learn it myself someday.
And if I say youve convinced me, are we done, I wonder?
Not yet. We have to talk about some kei scenes a little bit more
key
If you watch the movie you should notice about the part that Elisa takes the strange creature to her apartment
Ah yes. The infamous Grinding Nemo scene has to come up, I suppose
I admire anyone who can communicate sensuality from under about 8 hours of creature makeup.
See why Doug deserves awards?

Maybe you are right about Doug deserving award, but about the movie Elisa keeps the creature in her bathtub, adding salt to the water to keep him alive and she
plans to release it into a nearby canal when it will be opened to the ocean in
several days' time.
but they fall in love and the story gets complicated
I would imagine... gonna be hard for her to live in water
The creature has some super abilities
that can heal himself and others

uid1response.feedback: Still a bit choppy and bot-like, the copy pasting is obvious. Also I wasn't viewing a document so I didn't check that.
